business.headline: Gensol Engineering shares hit 5% lower circuit for 2nd straight dayGensol Engineering share price: The stock plunged 5% to Rs 117.50 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), hitting yet another all-time low.

Explained: Why Nvidia's market value dropped $148 billion overnightNvidia shares were hit hard in the overnight trading session on Wall Street, falling nearly 7% and losing $148 billion in market value.

Wipro shares tank 6% in early trade despite strong Q4 earnings. Buy or sell?Wipro share price: At 9:20 am, Wipro shares were trading 5.33% lower at Rs 234.30 on the Bombay Stock Exchange. The decline came after the company reported its earnings post-market hours on Wednesday.

Sensex loses over 300 points in early trade, Nifty below 23,400; Wipro down 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 344.50 points to 76,700.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 119.70 points to 23,317.50 as of 9:30 am.

Rio Tinto partners with Indian firm to explore low-carbon aluminium projectThe potential development could see up to 1 million tonnes per annum (mtpa) of primary aluminium smelting and 2 mtpa of alumina production, both energized by renewable wind and solar power, supported by pumped hydro storage, the global miner said.

Stock market opening today: Sensex, Nifty likely to open lower. Here's whyDespite the weak outlook for Thursday's session, Sensex and Nifty have seen a strong upward trend in the last few days. In the past three sessions, Nifty50 has gone up by 4.6% while Sensex has gained 4.3%.

Stocks to watch on April 17: Wipro, Gensol, Tata Steel, BEL, Paytm, Hero MotoCorpSeveral companies will announce their results for Q4 FY25 on Thursday. These include Infosys, HDFC Life Insurance Company, Jio Financial Services, HDFC Asset Management Company, Tata Elxsi, National Standard (India), and E2E Networks.

TCS gets 21 acres in Visakhapatnam for just 99 paisa as Andhra bets big on techThe cabinet of Andhra Pradesh cleared the proposal on Tuesday, stating that the project is expected to bring in an investment of around Rs 1,370 crore and create nearly 12,000 jobs.

Old or New Tax Regime: Here's how to pick the right one before filing ITRUnder the old tax regime, taxpayers can claim various deductions and exemptions, while the new tax regime does not offer much deductions.

ITR filing: How is tax refund calculated, and when will you get it?When you file your return, you declare your income, claim deductions, and report taxes already paid. The tax system compares your actual tax due with what you've already paid. If you've paid more, the extra amount is returned to you as a refund.
Wipro Q4 results: Net profit rises 26% to Rs 3,570 croreRevenue from operations saw a modest 1% year-on-year increase, reaching Rs 22,504 crore, compared to Rs 22,208 crore in Q4FY24.
Sensex closes 300 points higher, Nifty above 23,400; banking stocks gainThe S&P BSE Sensex added 309.40 points to close at 77,044.29, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 108.65 points to end at 23,437.20.

Inside Gensol's loan fraud: The fake documents used to hide debtSebi found that when the credit rating agencies asked Gensol to share term loan statements from all its lenders, the company shared documents for most lenders, except for IREDA and PFC.

White House fact sheet sparks confusion about 245% tariff on ChinaWhile a White House fact sheet mentions that China now faces up to 245% tariffs, the usual brouhaha by Donald Trump while making such announcements was missing.

Who are Gensol's promoters Anmol and Puneet Singh Jaggi?According to Sebi's findings, both Anmol and Puneet are accused of misusing company funds. The market regulator claims that the promoters treated the company like their personal business.
Explained: Why IndusInd Bank shares jumped 6% todayShares of IndusInd Bank were trading 5.51% higher at Rs 776.40 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) around 12:34 pm.

Over 3 million iPhones sold: Apple likely to post best-ever quarter in IndiaThe Q1 2025 number is a big jump from the 2.21 million iPhones sold in the same period last year. It shows how fast Apple is growing in India, a market that is becoming more important for the company every year.

Investment advisor warns against inflation: 'By 2030, you'll own less, pay more'Abhijit Chokshi stated in his post that most people think inflation means things getting expensive. But he explains that inflation has two faces. One is visible inflation and the other is invisible inflation.

PwC shuts down operations in more than a dozen countries: ReportThe decision was taken due to mounting differences with local partners. Local leaders at the firm said they lost over a third of their business in recent years after pressure from PwC's global executives to drop risky clients.

How Gensol promoter used company funds to buy ultra-luxury DLF Camellias flatDLF Camellias is a luxury housing project located in Sector 42, Gurgaon. It comprises 4 BHK, 5 BHK, and 6 BHK luxury apartments. Prices for these upscale homes begin at Rs 70 crore.
IREDA share price jumps 6% after strong Q4 results. All you need to knowIREDA shares jumped sharply after strong Q4 earnings, though asset quality concerns could temper gains in the near term.

Gensol Engineering share price crashes to all-time low. Should you buy or avoid?The stock has now crashed 84% since the start of 2025 and is down nearly 87% over the past year, making it one of the worst-performing listed firms in the clean energy space.

Sensex, Nifty trade flat after 2-day tariff relief rally; Gensol shares tumble 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 84.98 points to 76,649.91 at 9:23 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 26.25 points to trade at 23,302.30. However, broader market indices did not see any major dip, and it is likely to provide relief to retail investors.
Gensol Engineering shares in focus today as Sebi takes action against promotersGensol Engineering shares have plunged 83% this year, and the market regulator's interim order may deepen the sell-off.

Sebi vs Jaggi brothers: What's in the interim order over wrongdoings?During its probe, the market regulator found 'blatant violation of rules of corporate governance' and 'alleged wrongdoings'.  It said that the promoters were running Gensol like a private firm.

Sebi bans Gensol's Jaggi brothers for diverting company funds for personal useSebi has passed an interim order barring promoters Anmol Singh Jaggi and Puneet Singh Jaggi from taking part in the securities market and from holding any position as directors or key managerial personnel in any listed company.

Government, Swiggy join hands to boost jobs in gig, delivery sectorThe government said the partnership with Swiggy would help take the National Career Service portal deeper into the gig economy space.

How Niu Gensheng, China's dairy tycoon, rose from poverty to prosperityNiu Gensheng was born into a poor family in Inner Mongolia. His parents couldn't afford to raise him, so they sold him to a cattle farmer. The farmer adopted him, but life was still full of challenges.

Retail inflation eases further to 3.34% in March, lowest since August 2019The March CPI inflation print came in below February's 3.61%, marking the second straight month that inflation has stayed under the Reserve Bank of India's 4% medium-term target.

Hermes overtakes LVMH in market value years after takeover dramaWay back in 2010, LVMH's billionaire CEO Bernard Arnault shocked the corporate world by acquiring a huge stake in Hermes. It was seen as an effort to seize control of the company. But the Hermes family fought back. They came together to defend their brand and ultimately made Arnault sell his shares.

Sensex gains nearly 1,600 points, Nifty above 23,300; IndusInd bank gains 7%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 1,577.63 points to close at 76,734.89, while the NSE Nifty50 added 500 points to end at 23,328.55.

Dalal Street dusts off Trump's April 2 tariff shock, stages full comebackTrading resumed after a long weekend, but there was no slowdown in terms of momentum. The Nifty50 climbed as much as 2.4% intraday, comfortably reclaiming its pre-tariff territory, while the Sensex gained over 1,600 points.

UPS vs NPS: Which pension scheme should you opt forThe Unified Pension Scheme is the new retirement scheme effective from April 1, 2025. It is for central government employees. If you're currently under NPS, you'll have the option to shift to this new plan.

This multibagger stock has given 13,000% return. Should you buy?Since its stock market debut on July 28, 2003, the company has delivered a return of nearly 12,951.78%. It touched its 52-week high of Rs 2,559.95 on September 4, 2024.

Adani Green share price jumps 5% today after Q4 business update. Check detailsThe stock rose as much as 5.33% in early trade to hit Rs 941.40 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). At around 1:05 pm, the shares of the company were trading 4.17% higher at Rs 931.

USD vs INR: CA explains which one actually holds more valueCA Nitin Kaushik said that some people argue that salaries in India grow faster. Though he doesn't deny it, he questions whether that trend still holds true today.

Sensex, Nifty jump 6% in two sessions. Are Dalal Street bulls back on track?While the sharp rebound in equity markets has reignited investor enthusiasm, experts are urging caution amid ongoing global uncertainties, especially around the US trade policy.

'Rich Dad Poor Dad' author warns of giant market crash, bets on gold and BitcoinAccording to Robert Kiyosaki the rising gold, silver, and Bitcoin prices show that traditional ways of saving—like stocks, bonds, mutual funds, and ETFs—are no longer safe.

Should you buy HAL, BEL, Mazagon Dock, other defence stocks? Check price targetDefence companies are expected to do well for many positive reasons. These include higher government spending on defence, tensions between countries, a longer list of defence products being made in India, etc.

Explained: Why HDFC share price surged 4% today and what next?HDFC Bank's share price rose as the country's largest private lender, along with several other banks, cut its deposit interest rate by 25 basis points.

entertainment.headline: Kajol and Malaika Arora's heartwarming hug at Mumbai event wins InternetAt a recent Mumbai event, Bollywood stars Kajol and Malaika Arora shared a warm embrace, capturing the attention of fans and media alike. The duo's chemistry was the highlight of the evening, as fans couldn't stop gushing over the moment.

Apoorva Mukhija hints at vacating Mumbai house after India's Got Latent rowInfluencer and actor Apoorva Mukhija seemed to have moved out of her Mumbai house, months after India's Got Latent controversy. She shared a short video giving a glimpse of the empty house.

Picture abhi baki hai: Ranveer Allahbadia says 'brother' Samay Raina will be backRanveer Allahbadia conducted an 'Ask Me Anything' session on Instagram addressing the India's Got Latent controversy and the events that followed. He revealed stronger ties with Samay Raina and support for Ashish Chanchlani and Apoorva Mukhija.

Prithviraj and Malayalam celebs honoured at Kerala State Film Awards presentationChief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan presented Kerala State Film Awards (2023) in Thiruvananthapuram on Wednesday. Prithviraj Sukumaran, Urvashi and many others were honoured for their exceptional work.

Anurag Kashyap slams Brahmin outfits opposing Phule, calls out rigged systemAnurag Kashyap criticised Brahminical groups for opposing Hindi film 'Phule', highlighting issues of casteism and a compromised system. He questioned the access that fringe groups have to unreleased films and called out censorship practices.

Vijay Sethupathi reflects on working with director Puri JagannadhVijay Sethupathi recently shared his excitement about collaborating with director Puri Jagannadh. On being asked about the collaboration, he said it was the story that convinced him, not the filmmaker's past track record.
Stand-up comedian Nate Bargatze to host Emmys 2025Stand-up comedian Nate Bargatze will host the 77th Emmy Awards, live from Los Angeles. The event will take place on September 15 IST.

Citadel spin-offs cancelled, to merge storylines into main seriesPrime Video has decided not to continue with 'Citadel' spinoffs 'Honey Bunny' and 'Diana' as standalone series. Instead, their storylines will be integrated into the second season of 'Citadel', set for a global release in 2026.

Lebanon bans Disney's Snow White over Gal Gadot's support for IsraelLebanon has prohibited the screening of Disney's 'Snow White' due to the casting of Israeli actor Gal Gadot. The ban aligns with the country's ongoing boycott of Israeli artists amid regional tensions.

Actor Nazriya Nazim Fahadh 'struggling with emotional well-being': I shut downNazriya Nazim Fahadh opened up about her recent absence from the public eye, explaining that it was due to struggles with emotional well-being. She also extended her apologies and gratitude to her friends and supporters.

Pooja Hegde on break from Telugu films: Felt like a missing childPooja Hegde recently talked about why she has stayed away from Telugu films. She also spoke about her upcoming projects, and her return to Tollywood.

SS Rajamouli recalls Jr NTR's Komuram Bheemudo shoot in RRR: Tarak was possessed'RRR' director SS Rajamouli, who was in Japan to promote his Netflix documentary 'RRR: Behind and Beyond', praised Jr NTR's performance in the song 'Komuram Bheemudo', while interacting with the media.

Rohit Shetty, John Abraham join hands for Rakesh Maria's biopicJohn Abraham and Rohit Shetty are joining hands for a new film inspired by Rakesh Maria's life. The project will explore Maria's illustrious career in the Mumbai Police.

Radhika Apte to join Tabu and Vijay Sethupathi in Puri Jagannadh's next: ReportAfter years away from Telugu cinema, Radhika Apte is reportedly reuniting with filmmaker Puri Jagannadh for an intense pan-India project, also starring Vijay Sethupathi and Tabu.

Eddington teaser: Joaquin Phoenix, Pedro Pascal clash in Ari Aster's black comedyThe teaser of Ari Aster's latest film, 'Eddington', released on April 15. A black comedy, Eddington is set to premiere at the 2025 Cannes Film Festival.

How Nidhhi Agerwal transformed into a princess for Hari Hara Veera MalluTelugu-Tamil star Nidhhi Agerwal gears up for two major releases with Pawan Kalyan and Prabhas. In an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, she spoke about 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu', working with the two stars and more.

Kannada superstar Upendra explains how Coolie co-star Rajinikanth inspired himKannada actor-director Upendra, while interacting with the media at a press meet held in Hyderabad to promote his upcoming Kannada film '45', spoke about how he considered himself blessed to have had the opportunity to work with him.

Tamannaah on 'milky beauty' tag: I don't want to play the victimTamannaah Bhatia, during the promotion of her upcoming supernatural thriller, 'Odela 2', remarked that she does not want to "be in a victim-mode".

The Patriotism pattern: Why Akshay Kumar keeps returning to nationalist rolesAkshay Kumar returns to his patriotic roots with 'Kesari Chapter 2', portraying the role of C Sankaran Nair in a courtroom drama set against the backdrop of the Jallianwala Bagh massacre. Known for his consistent portrayal of nationalistic themes, Akshay remains Bollywood's go-to figure for films that resonate with Indian pride.

general news.headline: BCCI sacks batting, fielding coaches after poor show in Border–Gavaskar TrophyThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has removed assistant coach Abhishek Nayar, along with fielding coach T. Dilip and strength and conditioning coach Soham Desai, from their roles after India's 1-3 series loss in Australia.

CBI raids AAP leader days after he was appointed as Gujarat polls co-in-chargeThe CBI raided AAP leader Durgesh Pathak's residence in connection with alleged violations of FCRA (Foreign Contribution Regulation Act). AAP slammed the BJP, claiming that it was afraid of its rise in Gujarat.

Maharashtra okays new education policy, Hindi made compulsory third languageA major component of this plan is the introduction of Hindi as a compulsory third language for students in Classes 1 to 5 studying in Marathi and English medium schools.

I was pilot when development took off, now Fadnavis flying it: Eknath ShindeMaharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde likened the Mahayuti government to a "development aircraft," saying he was its pilot with Fadnavis and Ajit Pawar as co-pilots.

Picture abhi baki hai: Ranveer Allahbadia says 'brother' Samay Raina will be backRanveer Allahbadia conducted an 'Ask Me Anything' session on Instagram addressing the India's Got Latent controversy and the events that followed. He revealed stronger ties with Samay Raina and support for Ashish Chanchlani and Apoorva Mukhija.

RJD leader pitches Tejashwi Yadav as chief ministerial face ahead of meet todayThe assertion comes despite Tejashwi Yadav saying that the face of the Mahagathbandhan would be decided amicably in consultation with alliance partners.

BJP likely to get new chief by April-end as state-level polls conclude: SourcesSo far, 14 state presidents have been appointed, but as per the party's constitution, elections must be held in at least 19 states before the national presidential election can be conducted.

Cancer-stricken man kills wife, shoots himself in Ghaziabad, suicide note foundA cancer-stricken man shot dead his wife before turning the gun on himself in Ghaziabad. According to police, the victim left a suicide note saying he did not want to be a burden on his family to bear the cost of treating his cancer.

Watch: Neeraj Chopra begins 2025 season with winning throw at South Africa eventAhead of next month's Doha Diamond League, Neeraj Chopra competed in an invitational event in Potchefstroom, South Africa. Neeraj topped a six-man field with a best effort of 84.52m on Wednesday, April 16.

How Tejashwi gave Rahul, Kharge a Bihar poll reality checkIn 2020, the Congress contested a disproportionate number of seats, winning under a third of them and denying the RJD-led alliance a shot at power. Will 2025 be different?

No police protection for couples marrying against parents' wish: High CourtThe Allahabad High Court ruled that couples marrying against their parents' wishes cannot demand police protection as a right unless there's a real threat to their safety.

Tariffs capable of replacing income tax? Trump says there's a 'real chance'Drawing on historical precedent, Donald Trump argued that between 1870 and 1913, tariffs served as the primary source of government revenue and coincided with a period when the nation was "relatively the richest".

Why you can bet big on Haryana's Hisar, ready for take-off with a new airportA new airport isn't just bringing regional connectivity to Hisar, it is galvanising the steel city for a big leap into the future. Matching the Centre's big plans for Hisar as a defence-manufacturing and aviation-sector hub, Haryana itself is moving to put Hisar as a counter-magnet city outside the NCR.

Trump, Musk, Yunus among Time's 100 most influential people, no Indian in listTime magazine has released the 2025 edition of the 100 most influential people in the world, featuring prominent world leaders, including US President Donald Trump and Bangladesh's Chief Advisor Muhammad Yunus. However, no Indian was found in the list.

Fatwa against actor Vijay for controversial iftar party: He invited alcoholicsA Muslim cleric from Uttar Pradesh issued a fatwa against actor-politician Thalapathy Vijay. The Sunni ulema accused the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam chief of anti-Islamic conduct and political opportunism.

Gensol Engineering shares hit 5% lower circuit for 2nd straight dayGensol Engineering share price: The stock plunged 5% to Rs 117.50 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), hitting yet another all-time low.

Indian-origin scientist discovers signs of alien life outside Solar SystemScientists have detected possible biosignature gases in the atmosphere of exoplanet K2-18 b -- gases produced only by life on Earth -- hinting at the presence of microbial life.

Israel says its troops to stay in Gaza, Lebanon and Syria indefinitelyIsrael's defence minister says troops will stay in Gaza, Lebanon, and Syria indefinitely, complicating ceasefire and hostage negotiations.

Wanted RJD MLA Ritlal Yadav surrenders before Bihar court in extortion caseThe development comes days after an FIR was registered against Yadav and five others on the basis of a complaint filed by a Patna-based builder for demanding extortion money and threatening to kill him.

Sensex loses over 300 points in early trade, Nifty below 23,400; Wipro down 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 344.50 points to 76,700.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 119.70 points to 23,317.50 as of 9:30 am.

Apoorva Mukhija hints at vacating Mumbai home after India's Got Latent rowInfluencer and actor Apoorva Mukhija seemed to have moved out of her Mumbai house, months after India's Got Latent controversy. She shared a short video giving a glimpse of the empty house.

Iran 'not far' from nuclear bomb, warns UN watchdog chief Rafael GrossiThe IAEA remains tasked with monitoring Iran's nuclear activities and its compliance with the 2015 nuclear agreement, which began to unravel in 2018 following the US withdrawal under then-President Donald Trump.

Trump holds surprise tariff talks with Japan, claims 'big progress'President Trump met unexpectedly with Japan's trade delegation, calling the talks "big progress" as both sides agreed to hold a second meeting soon.

Nitish Rana breaks silence on Super Over snub vs DC: All decisions were rightDespite being RR's top performer with the bat, Nitish Rana stood by the management's call to send Riyan Parag and Shimron Hetmyer for the Super Over. RR's decisions in the key clash sparked criticism after DC clinched a tense win.

sports.headline:
Credit to Starc but saliva makes a lot of difference: Nitish on Super Over lossRajasthan Royals batter Nitish Rana credited Mitchell Starc for his sensational 20th over but added that the return of saliva has made a massive difference to the game.

"We had our moments, but Starc was ice cold under pressure...to execute 11 out of the 12 yorkers he bowled perfectly at 145 Km/hr with the ball reversing, you have to give him the due credit", Rana said in the post match press conference.

Rajasthan Royals batter Nitish Rana credited Mitchell Starc for his sensational 20th over but added that the return of saliva had made a massive difference to the game.

Watch: DC's KL Rahul calls out Yashasvi Jaiswal's dismissal by Kuldeep YadavFrom calling Jaiswal's dismissal behind the stumps to anchoring the Super Over finish, KL Rahul's all-round game awareness proved decisive. His brilliance helped Delhi Capitals seal a thrilling win against Rajasthan Royals.

Axar Patel provides update on Kuldeep, praises Starc after DC win Super OverDelhi Capitals captain Axar Patel said that he was enjoying his leadership stint in IPL 2025 while providing update on Kuldeep Yadav's injury sustained during the Super Over win over Rajasthan Royals.

BCCI sacks batting, fielding coaches after poor show in Border–Gavaskar TrophyThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has removed assistant coach Abhishek Nayar, along with fielding coach T. Dilip and strength and conditioning coach Soham Desai, from their roles after India's 1-3 series loss in Australia.

Nitish Rana breaks silence on Super Over snub vs DC: All decisions were rightDespite being RR's top performer with the bat, Nitish Rana stood by the management's call to send Riyan Parag and Shimron Hetmyer for the Super Over. RR's decisions in the key clash sparked criticism after DC clinched a tense win.

Watch: Hasan Ali apologises for 'King kar lega' remark to Babar AzamPakistan fast bowler Hasan Ali has apologised for his 'King Kar Lega' remark to Babar Azam in 2023. The fast bowler plays for Karachi Kings in the Pakistan Super League 2025.

Watch: Neeraj Chopra begins 2025 season with winning throw at South Africa eventAhead of next month's Doha Diamond League, Neeraj Chopra competed in an invitational event in Potchefstroom, South Africa. Neeraj topped a six-man field with a best effort of 84.52m on Wednesday, April 16.

UCL: Real Madrid's 'remontada' fails vs Arsenal, Bayern fall to InterA night of contrasting emotions in Europe — Real Madrid's fabled comebacks fell flat, and Thomas Müller bid a tearful goodbye to Champions League glory as Arsenal and Inter Milan marched into the semi-finals.

Saliva a game changer in IPL 2025? Starc disagrees after Super Over heroicsIPL 2025, DC vs RR: Mitchell Starc said he prefers using sweat over saliva on the red-ball. On Wednesday, Starc helped the Delhi Capitals beat the Rajasthan Royals in the Super Over clash at the Arun Jaitley Stadium.

Naman Dhir welcomes dry ball rule as relief for bowlersIPL 2025, MI vs SRH: In the pre-match press conference, Naman Dhir said that the introduction of the second ball has helped bowlers mostly because of dew playing big part in matches.

12 yorkers in 12 balls: Axar in awe of Starc after Super Over winIPL 2025, DC vs RR: Axar Patel heaped praise on Mitchell Starc, who won the Player of the Match award after Delhi Capitals beat Rajasthan Royals in the Super Over on Wednesday at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi.

Watch: Neeraj Chopra begins 2025 season with winning throw at South Africa eventAhead of next month's Doha Diamond League, Neeraj Chopra competed in an invitational event in Potchefstroom, South Africa. Neeraj topped a six-man field with a best effort of 84.52m on Wednesday, April 16.

UCL: Real Madrid's 'remontada' fails vs Arsenal, Bayern fall to InterA night of contrasting emotions in Europe — Real Madrid's fabled comebacks fell flat, and Thomas Müller bid a tearful goodbye to Champions League glory as Arsenal and Inter Milan marched into the semi-finals.

Saliva a game changer in IPL 2025? Starc disagrees after Super Over heroicsIPL 2025, DC vs RR: Mitchell Starc said he prefers using sweat over saliva on the red-ball. On Wednesday, Starc helped the Delhi Capitals beat the Rajasthan Royals in the Super Over clash at the Arun Jaitley Stadium.

Naman Dhir welcomes dry ball rule as relief for bowlersIPL 2025, MI vs SRH: In the pre-match press conference, Naman Dhir said that the introduction of the second ball has helped bowlers mostly because of dew playing big part in matches.

12 yorkers in 12 balls: Axar in awe of Starc after Super Over winIPL 2025, DC vs RR: Axar Patel heaped praise on Mitchell Starc, who won the Player of the Match award after Delhi Capitals beat Rajasthan Royals in the Super Over on Wednesday at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
